column2: The Network Engineer performs design, optimization, and audit of a network to meet the customer requirements. The role is focused on driving design, audit and optimization services, where they are responsible for part of the solution and service process. The Senior Engineer is responsible to upkeep time, performance, and quality according to Ericsson requirements and Customer contract.               What you will do                 Accountable for day-to-day delivery of the assigned project towards the MA and responsible for Nomination & Planning Activities.             Work with market area teams to implement the delivery plans in a time bound manner. Candidate should be able to understand the customer queries & proactively act on the same. Interact with internal and external stakeholders for delivery execution.             Analyze EPC/5GC CORE & IMS Core network performance and investigate the root cause(s) of performance degradations and also perform on demand analysis on specific issues (new performance degradation, customer complaint/s).             Provide recommendations to the customer to address the identified issues (IMS or EPC equipment parameter tuning with targeted value). Analyze, develop, and build new KPIs, counters, dashboards to complement our solution by added new value use cases answering to the major issues that could face a customer.             Assist stakeholders team in enriching solution with new use cases. Suggest improvements for tools with specific KPIs and new dashboards in a virtualized environment.             Perform workshops to transfer telecom knowledge and/or knowledge about new features/ solutions to customer s team and provide technical advice and support to customers and other teams in network. Participate to customer presentation to expose the findings and recommendations from the analysis.                 You will bring                 Experience: 8+ years and Qualifications: Engineering/or equivalent. Should have proven ability with 6 to 8 years of experience on network optimization and planning for 4G (EPC) Packet Core networks and 5G Core is also preferred.             Deep knowledge in Packet Core architecture, especially in 5GC & EPC Packet Core. Also understanding of LTE, VoLTE, VoWifi, Roaming and handover signalling flows and network configurations in Packet - Core.             Good knowledge of Ericsson MME, EPG, iDNS, eDNS, AAA, ePDG, SGW-C, PGW-C, AMF, SMF, UPF, NRF. Understanding of tools like ITK, EPP, ENIQ, ENM for the purpose of implementing and scheduling KPI reports and tuning and optimization of the same.             Understanding of Cloud Native deployments and Kubernetes and Ericsson ECCD.             5G SA or NSA experience is desirable.             Knowledge and exposure to different switching network, signalling, telecom standards and implementations, end-to-end knowledge on Packet Core & Voice over LTE call flow and/or deployment, feature testing/verification.             Experience with signaling protocols like SCTP, MAP, TCP/IP, Diameter, GTP C/U, PFCP and HTTP/HTTPS.             Understanding of Mobile Network different interfaces i.e. Iu, A, Gx, Gy, S1, S11, S5, S6a, SGS, SGi, N1/N2, N3/N4, Cx, Sh, Ro, Rx, Gm, Sxa, Sxb, etc.             Knowledge of E2E network architecture             Knowledge of IP routing concepts in telecom service provider environment.             Should have Multi Technology (GSM, LTE, 5GC) Optimization Skills on Ericsson Equipments. Should have good knowledge on Multi Tech Functionality, KPIs & Tuning.             Hands on Experience w.r.t 2G,4G&5G KPIs Tuning & Optimization. Good Understanding of Ericsson 2G,4& 5G Parameters, Features & Counters.             Should have very good experience on Performance Tools, ITK, ENM etc. Should be familiar in Trace Analysis. Automation Skills would be a big plus.
column11: GSM, Telecom, Automation, EPC, Scheduling, HTTP, SCTP, Signalling, IMS, Auditing

column2: QCT Multimedia R&D team is looking for a motivated engineer interested in design and implement new speech and audio ML models for headsets, XR devices and other consumer electronics products. You will be working with a team of ML experts to develop advanced noise suppression (NS), adaptive noise cancellation (ANC) and hearing assistive algorithms. The team includes ML experts who are bringing ML based solutions to consumer electronic products. It is a great opportunity to learn how to design ML models which work on products you can buy on stores.                   ?         Responsibilities:             Work with R&D engineers to help to design, evaluate, and demo new speech and audio features containing machine learning approaches.             After successful proof the algorithm performance, you will develop a demo prototype and work with various teams to commercialize the new feature, on this process you will:             Translate feature requests into sets of engineering requirements.         Review existing state of the art methods in the literature and propose potential solution directions.         Train new ML models using PyTorch (preferable) or TensorFlow for the target application.          Demonstrate effectiveness of proposed solution through performance evaluations.                 Minimum Qualifications             bachelors degree with 2 years of experience or masters degree in electrical engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.          Coding    experience in Python.     Knowledge of one of the NN training frameworks: PyTorch (preferred) and TensorFlow.     Familiar with common neural network architectures, namely LSTMs, CNNs, RNNs, etc               Preferred Qualifications             Coding experience in Matlab.         Interested in working with cutting edge applications and learn how to make them products.         Willing to work in cross disciplinary, geographically dispersed teams.         Knowledge of traditional signal processing theory on any of the following:         Active noise control          Acoustic Echo cancellation and noise suppression          Adaptive filtering for audio applications                         Minimum Qualifications:         Bachelors degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience.    OR   Masters degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 1+ year of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR   PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field
column11: Prototype, Coding, Staffing, Machine learning, Signal processing, MATLAB, Consumer electronics, Python, Recruitment

column2: QCT Multimedia R&D team is looking for a motivated engineer interested in design and implement speech and audio new      DSP      algorithms for headsets, XR devices and other consumer electronics products. You will be working with a team of DSP experts to develop advanced noise suppression (NS), adaptive noise cancellation (ANC) and hearing assistive algorithms. The team includes DSP algorithm designs who brought millions of consumer electronic products to the market. It is a great opportunity to learn how to design algorithm which work on products you can buy on stores.                            Responsibilities:              Work with R&D engineers to help to design, evaluate, and demo new speech and audio features containing traditional digital signal processing (DSP) algorithm approaches.              After successful proof the algorithm performance, you will develop a demo prototype and work with various teams to commercialize the new feature, on this process you will:              Translate feature requests into sets of engineering requirements.          Review existing state of the art methods in the literature and propose potential solution directions.          Prototype new algorithms in MATLAB, Python, or C/C++          Demonstrate effectiveness of proposed solution through unit testing and comprehensive performance evaluations                  Minimum Qualifications              bachelors degree with 2 years of experience or masters degree in electrical engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.          Coding experience in C/C++.        Experience with MATLAB and/or Python.      Knowledge of traditional audio digital signal processing (DSP) algorithms development and implementation.                Preferred Qualifications              Willing to work in cross disciplinary, geographically dispersed teams.        Familiar with PyTorch and common neural network architectures, namely LSTMs, CNNs, RNNs, etc        masters degree          Experience in the theory of any of the following:              Active noise control (traditional signal processing)          Acoustic Echo cancellation and noise suppression (traditional signal processing)          Audio equalization (traditional signal processing)          Adaptive filtering for audio applications                  Education Requirements:    B      achelors or masters degree in Computer Engineering / Computer Science / Electrical Engineering                            Minimum Qualifications:          Bachelors degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience.    OR    Masters degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 1+ year of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR    PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.
column11: C++, Prototype, Coding, Digital signal processing, Signal processing, Unit testing, MATLAB, Consumer electronics, Python
